channel.title: Custom Crafting/Using two items together to get another item
channel.description: Ok so I've used the search bar and google. I've searched for about 3 days and cannot find a solution to this. Ok so what I need help with is using two different items together to get a new item. Like for example "runite bar + santa = red Party hat." That is an example. I need help on this. Basicly im asking help for using two items to get a new item. Like potions for example. Using a one dose potion with a three dose potion gives a four dose potion and an empty vial. Heres a more specific exampe. "click use on runite bar" "click use runite bar on santa hat" "gets new item" "new item is red Phat" "runite bar and santa hat get deleted" "leaving red phat". If someone could help me I would need some what of a spoon fed guide. So if someone could help me I would appreaciate it very much =p. BTW im using a Project Insanity source. =P

item.title: Custom Crafting/Using two items together to get another item
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

I really do love you sometimes Vain <3

Read full topic

item.title: Custom Crafting/Using two items together to get another item
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]src>server>model>items>UseItem

if (itemUsed == ITEM_ONE && useWith == ITEM_TWO || itemUsed == ITEM_TWO && useWith == ITEM_ONE) { c.getItems().deleteItem(ITEM_ONE, c.getItems().getItemSlot(ITEM_ONE), AMOUNT); c.getItems().deleteItem(ITEM_TWO, c.getItems().getItemSlot(ITEM_TWO), AMOUNT); c.getItems().addItem(ITEM_THREE, AMOUNT); } [/quote]

hmm question vain…would this work for let’s say the smelting stuff? I could make it delete let’s say 8 coal and 1 runite ore then it would add the runite bar?

Read full topic
item.source: Custom Crafting/Using two items together to get another item

if (itemUsed == ITEM_ONE && useWith == ITEM_TWO || itemUsed == ITEM_TWO && useWith == ITEM_ONE) { c.getItems().deleteItem(ITEM_ONE, c.getItems().getItemSlot(ITEM_ONE), AMOUNT); c.getItems().deleteItem(ITEM_TWO, c.getItems().getItemSlot(ITEM_TWO), AMOUNT); c.getItems().addItem(ITEM_THREE, AMOUNT); } [/quote]
once AGAIN I vain I beats me to the answer.

Read full topic
